item.title: Camden council and Veolia not acting on reports, 4th December
item.description:
FixMyStreet ref: 8501782. As per original reports no 8500058 and 8501782. Leaves from the road and the pavement have not been cleared this autumn at all. Veolia only cleans the main roads e.g. Lady Somerset, Burghley Rdetc. it IS the Council’s responsibility so please resolve instead of closing the report and writing ‘not the council’s responsibility’. There has been a visible decline in street cleaning in the NW5 area (including dog waste not being cleaned) since Veolia has got their 8 years contract extension last summer. Council and Veolia need to sort it out and stop sending the residents away saying it’s not their responsibility. Camden council has just been notified about the flooding herein. The responsibility ultimately lies with Camden council (who’s responsible for liaising with its subcontractors). if the flooding repeats and damages the nearby properties it will be Camden council that will be sued for not acting on repeated resident reports
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burghley Road, Tufnell Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Debris accumulation in Kelsey Park, 4th December
item.description:
The debris at the base of the waterfall in Kelsey Park has been there for months. The debris consists of litter and pieces of wood which restricts the water flow. The waterfall flows between the main lake and the lower lake. The debris needs to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kelsey Park Avenue, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barrier at width restriction removed, 4th December
item.description:
The barrier for the width restriction has been removed again. This was an ongoing problem until the local councillors were involved. Traffic is now speeding through the barrier and mounting the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Watts Lane, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parked vehicle, small car not moved, 4th December
item.description:
Hello, Please read my enquiry as I would like to say we have a dangerous parking of abandoned car. I would like to report a vehicle that has not been moved for over three-weeks. That vehicle has been reported, but that parking of that road vehicle is on entry side of the road. You do realise what this means: traffic entering from Upper Elmers End Road cannot enter Goddard Road, if, there are two or more vehicles on exit side of the road. What if a fire engine was entering Goddard Road, and there were cars exiting the road, that vehicle was parked on the most dangerous side of the road. As least it should be moved to the exit side of the road, please. Surely the authority can get in touch with the owner of the vehicle. I would like to let you know what I HAD to do recently with a long wheelbase Peugeot van. When I entered Goddard Road I had to wait for two vehicles to come out in the main road before I could enter the road, as there was no room to manoeuvre the large vehicle I was driving, past those vehicles. As that parked vehicle is parked on the wrong side of Goddard Road. Please reply to me as I would like to know how long this is going to take to remove the vehicle. No one who lives in Goddard Road parks their vehicle on the ENTRY side of the road as that cuts the road to half a road width.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goddard Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dip to the right and after speed bump, 4th December
item.description:
Travelling from Townley Road this dip, which is a poor repair, has caused damage to my car, underneath the front spoiler on the driver’s side. My car is not super low and is unaffected by any speed bump - I use Upton Road daily. The incident happened on 19th Oct at approx 11:30 am.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upton Road, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti visible from highway, 4th December
item.description:
Why has this been noted as “not the council’s responsibility”? In October 2019 I reported this same wall covered in graffiti and the council painted over it. It is highly visible from the. Highway so it does meet the criteria for the council to remove it just as you did in 2019 (twice).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holly Hill Road, Lessness Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The street has not been swept or cleaned for weeks, 4th December
item.description:
As the headteacher at the school, I am writing to report that Woodberry Grove has not been swept or cleaned for a very long time. The fallen leaves have formed huge wet, slippery piles along the gutters. As well as this, piles of litter have formed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woodberry Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
